thread.title: Left behind vandalism, spreading anti-national propaganda in Delhi University campus, claims ABVP
thread.title_full: Left behind vandalism, spreading anti-national propaganda in Delhi University campus, claims ABVP

author: FE Online
title: Left behind vandalism, spreading anti-national propaganda in Delhi University campus, claims ABVP
text:
Left behind vandalism, spreading anti-national propaganda in Delhi University campus, claims ABVP Left behind vandalism, spreading anti-national propaganda in Delhi University campus, claims ABVP Addressing the media, Ankit Sangwan, an ABVP member alleged the Left of vandalism and spreading anti-national propaganda in the Delhi University campus. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 28, 2017 4:30 PM ABVP members stated that they won’t tolerate anti-national slogans in their campus and will protest and fight against it. (PTI) 
As heated controversy continues following Kargil Martyr’s daughter Gurkeerat Kaur’s soial media campaign against the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) after violence in the Ramjas College, the RSS backed group has today claimed that the violence among the students were intrigued by left wing parties. Further claiming that the speech of JNU student Umar Khalid was actively opposed by the DU students, the ABVP members stated that they won’t tolerate anti-national slogans in their campus and will protest and fight against it. Addressing the media, Ankit Sangwan, an ABVP member alleged the Left of vandalism and spreading anti-national propaganda in the Delhi University campus. 
The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sang (RSS) backed also alleged that the professors of the college are also involved in inviting ‘anti-nationals’ in the campus and stated miscreants from outside are trying to spoil the atmosphere of the campus through violence and snti-national slogans. Delhi University student union have a stand of their own, says ABVP member #ParadePolitics pic.twitter.com/3JT3TLwjH0 
— TIMES NOW (@TimesNow) February 28, 2017 
Days back violence erupted at the Ramjas college of the Delhi University, as right-wing ABVP opposed the invitation of JNU student Umar Khalid at a seminar in the college. Following the violence, Kargil martyr’s daughter Gurmehar Kaur, started a social media campaign stating that she is not scared of the ABVP. 
Over her campaign, Gurmehar received several threats and had also been trolled by celebrity figures like Virender Sehwag, Randeep Hooda. Trolling the DU student over a video she shared last year, saying that ‘Pakistan didn’t kill my father, war killed him’, Virendra Sehwag trolled her saying, ‘i didn’t score two triple centuries, my bat did’. 
Hitting out at those who had trolled her, Gurmehar Kaur earlier said, “To anyone questioning my courage and bravery. I’ve shown more than enough.” It has been learned that students and teachers from Delhi University and JNU will hold a march from Khalsa College to Arts Faculty. According to reports, left-wing student organisation AISA will carry out march even as NSUI is planning to sit on hunger strike. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal had said ‘DCW Home Guards’ were providing security to the Kargil martyr’s daughter, who complained of receiving “rape threats” allegedly from ABVP members. Gurmehar Kaur (20), a Delhi University student, met Maliwal and alleged that she had been receiving rape threats on social media allegedly by ABVP members. Please Wait while comments are loading...
